description: Unique identifier for the LandPKS Soil ID site
Name of the LandPKS Soil ID site
Privacy setting of the site or its parent project
Whether site is archived
Whether site has been viewed by the user
Date and time the site was last updated (e.g., "2025-01-15T14:30:00.000000+00:00")
Project containing the site
Site-level soil measurements and depth intervals
Site observation notes
Soil identification matches
Latitude of the LandPKS site (-90 to 90)
Longitude of the LandPKS site (-180 to 180)
Height of the site above mean sea level (meters)
Unique identifier for the LandPKS Soil ID project
Name of the LandPKS Soil ID project
Description of the LandPKS Soil ID project
Pinned note displayed on all sites in the project (shown as first note in JSON export)
Date and time the project was last updated (e.g., "2025-01-15T14:30:00.000000+00:00")
Project-level soil collection settings
Depth interval preset for the project
Custom depth intervals defined by the project
Label for the depth interval
Start depth of the interval (cm)
End depth of the interval (cm)
Effective depth interval preset for the site
Depth interval measurements for the site
Lower estimate of slope steepness as percent rise (e.g., 5 means 5% grade or 5 ft rise per 100 ft horizontal)
Upper estimate of slope steepness as percent rise (e.g., 15 means 15% grade)
Shape of the downhill slope
Shape of the slope perpendicular to downhill direction
Presence and intensity of surface cracks

Notes entered for the site. Format: content | author_email | timestamp; (next note). Newlines shown as â†µ. Example: "Soil was moist after rain | jane@example.com | 2025-01-15T14:30:00+00:00; Rocky area near creek | john@example.com | 2025-01-14T10:00:00+00:00"
Label of the soil pit depth (e.g., "0-1 cm", "1-10 cm", "10-20 cm")
Upper bound of the soil pit depth interval (cm)
Lower bound of the soil pit depth interval (cm)
Source preset for this depth interval
Percent of rock fragments in the soil sample
Texture class of the soil sample
Munsell color values of the soil sample (e.g., "10YR 4/3", "5YR 3/2"). Computed from colorHue, colorValue, colorChroma.
Whether soil color was determined through photo analysis
Soil dampness (moist/dry) of the sample
Lighting conditions of the sample photo
Whether texture collection is enabled for this interval
Whether color collection is enabled for this interval
Note identifier
Note text content
Whether note was deleted via cascade
User who authored the note
Author user identifier
Author email address
Author first name
Author last name
Author profile image URL
Geographic region for soil data (US or GLOBAL)
Array of soil match results
Soil series selected by the user as best match (e.g., "Literr", "Togasara")
Subgroup of the soil series selected by the user (e.g., "Typic Argixerolls")
Description of the soil selected by the user
Soil series suggested by the algorithm as best match
Subgroup suggested by the LandPKS Soil ID algorithm (e.g., "Pachic Argixerolls")
Description of the soil suggested by the algorithm
User's feedback on the top algorithmic match: Selected, Rejected, or Unsure
Data source (SSURGO, STATSGO, HWSD)
User's rating for this match
Distance to nearest map unit in meters
Combined match scoring
Data-based match scoring
Location-based match scoring
Detailed soil information for this match
Ranking position (0 = best)
Match score (0-1)
Soil series information
Land capability classification
Ecological site information
Reference soil data from the database
Soil series name (e.g., "Catden", "Sirdrak")
Taxonomic subgroup (e.g., "Typic Argixerolls")
Full soil series description
URL to full soil series description
Ecological site name (e.g., "Loamy Upland", "Sandy Bottomland")
Ecological site ID (e.g., "R042XB012NM")
Class 1-8 (1=fewest limitations, 8=most severe) + subclass: e=erosion hazard, w=wetness/excess water, s=soil limitations (shallow, droughty, stony), c=climate. Examples: "3e", "6w"
Capability class (1-8)
Subclass (e, w, s, c)
Reference slope value from soil database
Reference depth-dependent data from soil database
Start depth of the interval (cm)
End depth of the interval (cm)
Reference texture class
Reference rock fragment volume. Values indicate percentage range (e.g., VOLUME_15_35 means 15-35%)
Reference Munsell color string (e.g., "10YR 4/3", "5YR 3/2")
